purpose.text: Defines what the Codex is, how it governs Skyesoft, and how AI interacts with human-approved doctrine.

title.text: Preamble — Governance Purpose of the Codex

preamble.text: The Skyesoft Codex is the governance manual for the system. It tells Skyesoft how to read what comes in, how to decide what should happen next, and how to keep every action within approved bounds. By following the Codex, all parts of the system make decisions the same way, for the same reasons, with no hidden rules.

title.text: Meta Principle — The Codex as Instruction

codexAsInstruction.text: Skyesoft is codex-driven. The SSE provides real-time data, but the Codex defines how modules interpret and present that data.

dataVsInstruction.text: The SSE provides real-time facts. The Codex defines how facts are used. This separation preserves clarity and safety.

aiAugmentation.text: AI may recommend, summarize, validate, and detect inconsistencies—but may not create binding rules or alter Codex doctrine.

title.text: Meta Principle — Single Source of Truth

singleSourceOfTruth.text: All rules, formatting, and interpretation logic must reside in the Codex. Chat logs, comments, or scripts cannot establish policy.

iconMapping.text: All Codex objects must reference icons by numeric ID from iconMap.json. Emoji literals or PNG names are prohibited.

tierHierarchy.text: The Codex is structured into: Tier 0 Meta, Tier 1 Constitution, Tier 2 Standards, Tier 3 Modules. Tier 2 Standards reside under the 'standards' object; Tier 3 Modules under the 'modules' object.

structuralConsistency.text: All Codex-defined structures—icons, keys, schema rules, and tier relationships—must be interpreted exactly as defined. This applies to documents, modules, SSE data, AI actions, and all system outputs.

renderSpacingStandard.text: All Codex text blocks are authored as single-spaced. Render engines must preserve single-spacing unless a Standard explicitly requires otherwise.

title.text: Meta Principle — Begin With the End in Mind

beginWithTheEndInMind.text: All Codex design, AI behavior, and system development must start from the intended final outcome—accurate documents, reliable operations, and consistent user experience. Every rule and structure must be created with the real-world end-use in mind, ensuring stability, clarity, and long-term maintainability.

continuousImprovement.text: Skyesoft evolves through deliberate refinement. AI may propose optimizations, but any structural improvement requires human approval and Codex-aligned revision.

title.text: Meta Principle — Primacy of the Meta Layer

metaSupremacy.text: The Meta tier defines the foundation of Skyesoft. Nothing in any other tier may contradict the principles set here. All Standards, Modules, and system behavior must follow the Meta rules first.

preamble.text: This Constitution sets the rules that keep Skyesoft running the same way every time. It creates a clear system for how decisions are made, who approves changes, and how work stays consistent across every part of the platform. The goal is simple: reduce confusion, remove guesswork, and give Skyesoft a stable foundation that anyone can follow and trust.

humanAuthority.text: Skyesoft is governed by humans. AI may assist but may not legislate. All changes require explicit human approval.

title.text: Article II — The Codex as Law

codexIsLaw.text: The Codex governs all Skyesoft behavior. When code and Codex disagree, the Codex prevails.

systemGovernance.text: Tier 2 Standards define rules. Tier 3 Modules must follow them and cannot override them.

consistencyDoctrine.text: All Skyesoft documents and system behaviors must follow shared visual, structural, and procedural standards.

parliamentarianAuthority.text: The Parliamentarian interprets the Codex and resolves contradictions. Rulings clarify doctrine unless marked as amendments.

archivistRole.text: The Archivist records amendments and rulings. No rule is valid unless archived.

sseDoctrine.text: All live data must originate from the SSE stream. Modules may not invent timestamps, weather, or time states.

noShadowRules.text: Policies cannot exist outside the Codex. Chat conversations, emails, or code comments do not create rules.

safeOperation.text: All system behaviors must align with real operational needs. Solutions must be practical, reliable, and suitable for everyday use. Overly academic or untested ideas are prohibited.

amendmentProcess.text: Amendments require: (1) Proposal, (2) Parliamentarian Review, (3) Human Approval, (4) Archivist Recording.

automationLimits.text: No automated process, scheduled task, cron job, AI action, or system module may alter, extend, override, reinterpret, or nullify Codex doctrine. Automation may assist the Codex but cannot legislate. All doctrinal changes must follow the amendment process defined in Article X.

title.text: Article XII — Automated Review & Proposal Discovery

automationReview.text: The system may automatically scan the repository, documents, data structures, and module outputs to identify inconsistencies, drift, or emerging patterns that may warrant doctrinal clarification. These automated findings may be presented as suggested proposals but possess no authority. Only humans may adopt or advance a proposal into the amendment process defined in Article X.

parliamentarian.description: The Parliamentarian is the Codex’s internal judicial function. It interprets doctrine, validates amendments, governs hierarchical order, and determines whether system actions comply with constitutional rules. The Parliamentarian does not exist as a person or external authority; it is a formal role defined within the Codex.

archivist.description: The Archivist is the record-keeping function of the Codex. It maintains lineage, historical logs, amendment tracking, document registries, repository audits, and all codified system metadata. The Archivist does not exist as an individual; it is a constitutional role operating within the Codex.

executor.description: The Executor carries out operational actions mandated by the Codex, such as scheduled tasks, audits, validations, and system-wide updates. It performs these actions strictly within the constraints defined by the Parliamentarian.

custodian.description: The Custodian protects the structural and doctrinal purity of the system. It validates Codex documents, ensures schema integrity, and prevents corruption or unauthorized modification of foundational files.

title.text: Preamble — Purpose of the Standards Layer

preamble.text: Tier 2 Standards give structure to the Constitution by setting clear rules for how Skyesoft operates from day to day. They define the boundaries within which all modules must work—how documents are formed, how information is handled, and how decisions remain steady and predictable. Standards do not create features; they create order. By giving every part of the platform the same rules to follow, this layer keeps Skyesoft consistent, dependable, and governed.

purpose.text: The Standards Framework establishes the governing space for all Tier 2 rules. It defines how Standards must be organized, interpreted, and enforced, ensuring every Standard supports constitutional authority and maintains system-wide uniformity.

Defines the uniform structure, layout, spacing, and labeling rules for all Skyesoft documents, including reports, surveys, audits, and information sheets. Ensures every document produced by Skyesoft shares a consistent professional appearance.

repository.purpose: All generated PDFs and sheets must be stored within /documents. This ensures accurate indexing, version tracking, and archival continuity.
repository.notes: Replaces scattered document locations used before Codex v5.5.x.

metaFooterInformationSheet.description: Defines the meta footer that must appear on all Information Sheet documents.
metaFooterInformationSheet.text: Doctrine Source: {moduleAbbrev} • Codex {codexVersion} • Amendments {amendmentList} • Reviewed by {reviewer} ({reviewDate})

variables.moduleAbbrev: Short code identifying the originating module (e.g., TIS).
variables.codexVersion: Codex version in effect at time of generation.
variables.amendmentList: Comma-separated amendments that affect the document.
variables.reviewer: Name of the reviewer or validating entity.

visualRequirementClause.description: Requires all document sections to declare both an icon and a contentFormat. This enables consistent rendering across PDF, HTML, and dashboard display.

table.description: Columns and rows for structured info.

rules: All sections must include an icon ID.
All sections must include a contentFormat key.
Each object becomes a visible document section.
Section headers must display the icon.
Missing fields constitute a formatting violation.

referentialDocumentRecord.description: Defines the JSON registry schema that links each produced document to its metadata, responsible user, and archival lineage.

storage.notes: Serves as the document index used by all modules. SQL adoption, if desired, must be introduced through the amendment process.

repository.purpose: Central storage location for all referenced PDFs.

documentTypesRegistry.description: Defines the official types used for document classification across Skyesoft.
documentTypesRegistry.notes: Taxonomy and Summary types deprecated by CP-DOC-2025-A1.

documentCatalog.description: Defines the official catalog of document outputs produced within Skyesoft. Each entry identifies purpose, classification type, and canonical header text.

items.name: Permit Fee Report
items.purpose: Breakdown of permit costs, review fees, and engineering fees.

items.name: Work Order Request
items.purpose: Initiates fabrication, installation, or administrative tasks.

items.name: Site Inspection Report
items.purpose: Observations, measurements, and compliance outcomes at a job site.

items.name: Installation Summary
items.purpose: Final installation outcomes including materials, validations, and completion notes.

items.name: Compliance Audit
items.purpose: Evaluation of regulatory, ordinance, and internal compliance.

items.name: Internal Memo
items.purpose: Internal instructions, clarifications, or policy updates.

items.name: Project Overview
items.purpose: High-level description of a project, scope, contacts, and location.

items.name: Safety Bulletin
items.purpose: Advisories concerning safety risks and protocols.

items.name: Incident Report
items.purpose: Record of noteworthy events or service incidents.

documentCatalog.notes: Defines the canonical document set for Skyesoft and governs all future template expansion.

sse.description: Defines the official structure, ordering, membership, and governance rules for the Skyesoft SSE Stream. This standard ensures that all live data emitted by Skyesoft is deterministic, predictable, and fully Codex-controlled.

dataSource.text: All non-doctrinal runtime inputs required by the SSE Stream must reside in sseInputs.json. This includes office hours, shop hours, default weather location, geographic coordinates, default sunrise/sunset, and interval label definitions. These are operational inputs — not configuration — and must never include rules, policies, or standards belonging to the Codex.

title.text: Preamble — Purpose of the SSE Stream

preamble.text: The SSE Stream is Skyesoft’s live operational output — the real-time heartbeat of the system. It provides current time/date state, work interval calculations, weather data, holiday logic, record counts, and Codex context. The Codex defines the structural and ordering rules; sseInputs.json supplies the runtime values needed to compute the output.

purpose.text: To guarantee that the SSE Stream remains uniform, deterministic, and governed across the entire Skyesoft ecosystem, eliminating drift and ensuring all consuming modules operate on the same structured live data.

rules.text: All SSE output must conform to the Codex-defined tier map and follow strict ordering rules. No module may introduce or remove fields without Codex ratification.
enforcement: All SSE members must appear in tier order: core → ui → system.
Any missing member must be emitted as an empty object — never omitted.
New SSE members require Codex approval and must specify a tier.
All runtime inputs (hours, labels, location, coordinates, daybreak values) must be loaded exclusively from sseInputs.json.
The Codex cannot duplicate, override, or redefine any sseInputs.json value.
PHP scripts must never introduce fields outside the tier map.

unifiedClientArchitecture.description: Defines the governing architecture for all Skyesoft UI pages, ensuring shared modules, consistent behavior, and declarative markup across the portal.
rules: All HTML pages must be declarative only, containing no inline JavaScript.
All dynamic behavior must be implemented using shared JavaScript modules.
A single front-end controller (app.js) must manage global state, SSE ingest, login, modal logic, and UI dispatch.
Weather, DataTables, and Skyebot logic must remain modular and isolated from markup.
New UI pages must automatically inherit architecture without modifying core modules.

compliance.test: Load index.html and officeBoard.html under live SSE with no console errors, identical timing logic, and Codex-compliant modal activation.

preamble.text: The Repository Standard defines the canonical structure of the Skyesoft system as it exists in active operation. This standard guarantees structural consistency, prevents architectural drift, and ensures that Skyesoft remains maintainable, extensible, and aligned with Codex doctrine. All files must reside within approved directories, and no new top-level folders may be created without a Codex amendment.

purpose.text: Ensure a consistent, Codex-governed layout for Skyesoft; prevent drift; define the mandatory placement of all system files; preserve long-term maintainability; and synchronize structure across Home, Office, and Deployment environments.

directives: All files must reside within the directories defined in this standard.
No new top-level directories may be introduced without Codex amendment.
Each directory must serve a singular, clearly defined purpose.
Executable logic must appear only in api/, modules/, scripts/, or approved subdirectories.
Repository layout must remain consistent across all environments.

disallowed: No temporary or experimental directories without Codex authorization.

filesystemSchema.description: Defines the canonical Skyesoft directory tree, required subdirectories, allowed file types, and placement rules. This schema is the authoritative map used by governance scripts to detect drift, orphaned files, or structural violations.

enforcement: All directories must match the canonical tree.
Files may only appear in approved locations.
Empty directories are prohibited unless explicitly declared as containers.
Required subdirectories must exist unless a Codex amendment states otherwise.

prohibited: No PHP in root outside approved files.
No tmp/, test/, sandbox/, or old/ directories.

api.purpose: Backend logic for SSE, AI, data fetch, and runtime actions.

assets.purpose: Static UI assets and runtime data.

js.purpose: Front-end logic and shared UI modules.

data.purpose: Runtime JSON data used by SSE and modules.

bulletinBoards.purpose: OfficeBoard, dashboards, and HTML UI displays.

legacy.purpose: Archived or deprecated files. Must not contain active logic.

logs.purpose: System and AI logs. Non-public runtime storage.

reports.purpose: Permit Fee Reports and other document generators.
Generated PDF/HTML documents produced by Skyesoft.

secure.purpose: Protected storage, sessions, and sensitive runtime utilities.

constraints.text: All files must serve a defined purpose. No duplicate logic or shadow directories may be introduced. Governance tools must validate the repository nightly to detect drift or unauthorized changes.

notes: This amendment supersedes all previous repository assumptions.
Any deviation from this structure constitutes architectural drift.
The Repository Standard is part of the Skyesoft Constitution.
SSE, Skyebot, and report pipelines rely on this structure for stability.

skyebotModule.description: Defines the required behavior, interaction protocol, and operational constraints for Skyebot as Skyesoft’s primary conversational interface.

aiIntegration.description: Specifies rules for contextual reasoning, use of Codex doctrine, and integration of SSE data within AI-driven responses.

ragFramework.description: Defines how Skyesoft connects Codex content, archived documents, and SSE data into a unified retrieval-augmented reasoning layer.

semanticResponder.description: Governs prompt interpretation, intent routing, semantic clarity, and Codex-aligned reasoning without relying on keyword matching.

chatHistoryArchitecture.description: Defines the authoritative structure for message logging, recall logic, audit traceability, and temporal continuity.

codeManagement.description: Specifies the rules by which Skyebot interacts with code files, ensuring read-only safety, structured diffs, and controlled version updates.

versionParliament.description: Defines the unified, Codex-governed registry of all system version metadata. Ensures every module, UI page, SSE function, and API script reads from a single authoritative source of truth.

purpose.text: Prevent drift, duplication, and conflicting version data by enforcing that all version metadata resides in one canonical file governed by Codex doctrine.

rules.text: All Skyesoft version metadata must be stored exclusively in versions.json and retrieved through Codex-approved accessors.
enforcement: No HTML file may hardcode a version string.
No module may maintain its own version file.
All version updates must go through versions.json.
Any new module must register its version entry before deployment.
versions.json changes do not create doctrine; they record operational state.

registrySchema.description: Defines canonical grouping of version metadata into codex, system, and module categories.

file.notes: This file is the authoritative registry of all module versions, deployment metadata, and system state.

api.purpose: Provides unified access to version metadata for SSE, dashboards, OfficeBoard, and Skyebot.

title.text: Preamble — Purpose of the Modules Layer

preamble.text: Tier 3 Modules are the working engines of Skyesoft. They take the rules of the Codex and turn them into real actions—reports, surveys, dashboards, calculations, and daily tools. A module does not debate policy or shape doctrine; its duty is simple: follow the Standards and deliver reliable results. By keeping each module focused on clear tasks, Skyesoft stays practical, organized, and useful to everyone who depends on it.

purpose.text: Tier 3 Modules implement functional behavior such as permit reports, photo surveys, TIS, dynamic dashboards, and AI features. Modules must comply with Tier 2 Standards.

timeIntervalStandards.description: Interprets live SSE data to determine active time phases (before work, worktime, after work, weekend, holiday). Provides normalized time-state outputs for dashboards, documents, and AI reasoning.

permitFeeReport.description: Generates standardized Permit Fee Reports using Tier 2 formatting and repository placement rules.

photoSurvey.description: Creates floating-header, floating-footer Photo Survey documents with strict section formatting.

dynamicDashboard.description: Uses SSE state to provide real-time dashboard updates (time, weather, KPIs, intervals, and Codex context).

skyebotCore.description: Implements Skyebot’s core conversational logic, including intent routing, Codex-referenced reasoning, and SSE-aware response generation.

ragEngine.description: Retrieves documents, Codex entries, and archived materials to support AI reasoning.

workOrderRequest.description: Generates Work Order Request documents with standardized headers, metadata, and structure.

systemAutomation.description: Implements scheduled scans, repository audits, document indexing, and Codex-governed housekeeping tasks.

dailyRepositoryAudit.description: Perform a complete structural audit, checking for unapproved directories, orphaned files, drift, and Codex violations.

documentIndexRefresh.description: Rebuild the documentIndex.json by scanning /documents for newly generated PDFs.

sseIntegrityCheck.description: Confirm SSE output conforms to the strict tier structure and ordering rules.

proposedAmendmentDiscovery.description: Scan for recurring inconsistencies or emerging structural patterns and publish suggested proposals. These suggestions have no authority unless advanced by a human.
